text:
Become a Kurd
Lots of people become Kurds and this will give you some tips and tricks onbecoming one .
Be aware that becoming a Kurd is not for the faint-hearted .
Do not
become a Kurd just for the " good bits " .
Steps
Decide what kind of Kurd you want to be .
There are Turkish Kurds , Syrian Kurds , Iraqi Kurds , Iranian Kurds , Sorani Kurds , Kurmanji Kurds and Hawrami Kurds .
Do some internet research or find a book about Kurds at a library or bookstore to help make this decision .
One should only become the kind of Kurd they can relate to the most .
Adhere to the religion .
Some 90 % of Kurds are Sunni Muslims following the Shafi legal code .
Luckily , conversion to Islam is very easy , one just needs to declare their faith , either to themselves or officially in a mosque .
The other 10 % are Yazidis , Yarsanis and Alevis .
While it is difficult to convert to Yazidism , Yarsanism and Alevism are much more accepting of converts and if you live in a big city , you should be able to find a Cemevi or a Yarsani temple .
Most Kurds focus more on being Kurds than being religious , so you do n't need to be overly religious or take part in all the religious rituals .
It 's more about being part of the group than anything else .
Change your name .
Usually you can legally change your name if you are 18 , but it depends where you live .
If you are a Turkish Kurd , you should choose a Kurdish first name and Turkish surname as Kurdish surnames are banned in Turkey .
If you are an Iraqi Kurd , choose a Kurdish first name , a religious male middle name and surname , and then a tribal or geographical designator .
If you are an Iranian Kurd , choose a Kurdish first name and an Iranian surname .
Dress and look like a Kurd .
This does
not
mean wearing traditional garb all the time , even though it is a wise idea to have a brown or olive green suit ( for men ) or a dress ( for women ) .
You can buy these from online stores , Ebay , and specialist shops .
Kurdish girls wear heavy makeup and have thick eyebrows and long lashes .
If you are female , invest in some eyebrow pencil , foundation and mascara , or get your eyebrows tinted .
If you are female and you are an Iraqi Kurd or Iranian Kurd , you might be expected to put a scarf over most of your hair .
It should be stylish , possibly designer .
Do n't forget the oversized sunglasses .
If you are male , wear baggy jeans , sports clothes , cologne or perfume , and always be clean-shaven .
Try to learn the lingo .
While textbooks and online resources for learning Kurdish are limited , it is possible to find a private tutor or go to a group language learning class , if you live in a European city .
If you live in a Midwestern hick town , you 're out of luck .
This is n't mandatory , but it is recommended that learn a third language depending on what kind of Kurd you are .
An Iranian Kurd would learn Farsi , an Iraqi Kurd would learn Arabic , and a Turkish Kurd would learn Turkish .
If you have a knack for languages , why not learn all three ?
Resources for these are much more abundant .
Meet other Kurds .
Join the community .
The aforementioned cities , like London , Paris and Berlin , should have Kurdish community centres where you can attend meetings , celebrations , commemorations , and protests .
Meeting other Kurds can also help with learning the language and finding love .
It is better for Kurds to marry other Kurds .
Be prepared to go to lots of protests .
Making signs and banners is a great way to bond with new friends .
Just stay safe !
Protests , especially at night , can be dangerous for young people on their own and could even get you arrested so make sure you stay in a group .
Get official documentation .
Sadly , there is no such thing as a " Kurdish passport " but you can apply for an Iranian , Iraqi , or Turkish passport , and an ID card in Iraq and Turkey .
If you have a passport that might make travelling to the Homeland difficult , like an American passport if you are an Iranian Kurd , that and your American citizenship might need to be renounced .
Consider marriage .
Marrying an Iranian citizen ( hopefully a Kurd ) will automatically give you Iranian citizenship .
Develop your political views .
Keep in mind that Kurdish people talk politics as often as English people talk weather .
If you are a Turkish Kurd , you would probably support the left-wing HDP .
The leader is currently imprisoned .
Disagreement with Erdogan is de rigueur .
Campaign for your basic human rights .
If you are an Iraqi Kurd , you already have a semi-autonomous jurisdiction ... and a problem with nepotism and corruption , so you would show a certain amount of distrust of the local govt. Campaign for further independence .
If you are an Iranian Kurd , you would generally not vote , having similar distrust for the govt. Campaign for the abolition of the death penalty .
Prepare to confront haters .
Sadly , even in this day and age , many people wo n't respect your decision to live as a Kurd so you need to be able to discuss it with them in a civilised way .
Do n't be overly zealous with people who might not be sympathetic .
Some subjects are only suitable for discussion with other Kurds .
Be articulate and confident .
You can practice this by joining a debate club , Model Un , or toastmasters .
Be prepared to be called " other " and " enemy " and " terrorist " .
This may be distressing so it helps if you consistently tell yourself that you are n't .
